data.title: [RA] Official Map Pool: Alter 13 maps' player spawns - aesthetics
data.body:
I went through the map pool and picked up a few maps that currently is unlikely to be affected by any change in the official map pool (e.g. #11143). It's just a reorganizing of the player spawns' letters (and some minor adjustments) that are mostly aesthetic but will make it easier for players to set up teams in the lobby.

Most of the erroneous player spawns are due to a bug (fixed in the next playtest/release - #11125) in the editor that sometimes scrambles the order of the letters when saving/exiting, or possibly old maps that was made before letters were introduced to the spawns. Regardless, here are some fixes:

All maps (13) in a zip: https://www.dropbox.com/s/05nf0xnpt0tba2i/13_maps_altered_playerspawns.zip?dl=0

**Forest Path**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15209/
![forest path compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076633/f325d1d4-50b7-11e6-884b-d1b7ce284f76.png)

**Bad Neighbors**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15207/
![bad neighbors compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076644/0ee467b4-50b8-11e6-9e95-a1848d2dd544.png)

**Mad Science**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15211/
![mad science compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076696/19dcf162-50b9-11e6-8c8d-feb492f93ba7.png)

**Puddles Redux**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15215/
![puddles redux compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076698/3038be46-50b9-11e6-9015-53e4c0455349.png)

**Poland Raid**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15212/
![poland raid compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076704/4c829a54-50b9-11e6-9afc-64c56955e8b1.png)

**Haos Ridges**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15210/
![haos ridges compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076706/58c9422c-50b9-11e6-9e2e-8a72f8440b1a.png)

**Vegetation**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15239/
![vegetation compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17078925/afd11e76-5101-11e6-8708-33d418dd56aa.png)

**A Path Beyond**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15206/
![a path beyond compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076711/882c7192-50b9-11e6-9ef1-0384aa35b377.png)

**All Connected**: http://resource.openra.net/maps/15205/
![all connected compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076717/be125a9c-50b9-11e6-912e-5901ce3c0fef.png)

![regeneration basin compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076725/ff2f5b7e-50b9-11e6-8437-0f9e7c0b03ce.png)

![pool party compare](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2715583/17076727/11edab1c-50ba-11e6-8699-e4d5bf067f51.png)

data.title: Harvesters should go to the closest ore after unloading ?
data.body:
Currently, after unloading at the refinery, the harvester continue on the last spot he mined from, and usually continue forward. This results in longer harvesting routes as time goes on, if not taken care of. 

Shouldn't the harvester use a shortest path algorithm ? And start by looking out for the closest ore after unloading ? 

I already see the "self-playing game" polemy coming miles ahead :) , but for my defence, I'm not advocating for a micro-free game, I'm against that and it's not my point. 

I'm just wondering why this is the current harvester behaviour, for me it doesn't makes much sense (although there is probably a reason behind), and it's adds unnecessary parasitical micro. 

It's not about "let's make the game easier", but more about "why is it harder than it should be" ?

data.title: Dune2k - WYSIWYG Production Menu
data.body:
Hi, 
look at this:

![wysiwyg_productionmenu](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16046997/17068673/a0da9d02-5052-11e6-8aef-c8e19eb54d4f.jpg)
(Obviousely a photoshop edit)

How do you like the idea of a what-you-see-is-what-you-get production menu (Dune2k exclusive)?
I have no Idea if it can be done at all, but I thought it would be a significant improvement for Dune2k. And as it happens, all the units fit perfectly in one window! One tab instead of four. Should make unit production a lot more manageable.

I want to try to implement this myself. But if you all strongly disagree with the idea, I won't start to worry about it.

Also, I'm away during weekend, so sorry if I don't respond immediately.

Cheers

data.title: Tiedied up d2k building build menu icon order.
data.body:
Changed BuildPalletteOrder values for all d2k buildings. Turrets last, defenses where they fit and all other buildings adjacent to, or in line with their prerequesites. Feels much better than before.

Also uploaded seven test maps using this modification to the resource center. Those are available on the current release build. They have "(+BetterBuildmenu)" after their name.

Also removed the construction_yard prerequisite from all buildings, which was just cluttering the tooltips.
ra mod has no conyard prerequiseites as well.

data.title: Added API and auto-complete description generator for ZeroBrane Studio
data.body:
https://studio.zerobrane.com is an Open Source cross-platform Lua IDE with code completion support. This adds a generator for the API definition.

I submitted a snapshot of the last OpenRA release to  https://github.com/pkulchenko/ZeroBraneStudio/pull/670. You don't have to wait for upstream inclusion. Just copy the API definition and interpreter files to your local installation and keep going.

This is how it looks in the IDE. You get tooltips and auto-completion:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/17059457/91bb2e04-5025-11e6-9136-1531835b7311.png)

I am not sure if it is technically possible with our current Lua bridge, but the IDE also allows you to extend interpreters for static code analysis and live debugging.

PS: Now available as a standalone plugin that needs to be placed in `ZBS/packages/` or `HOME/.zbstudio/packages` https://github.com/pkulchenko/ZeroBranePackage/blob/master/openra.lua

data.title: Right clicking Ore Mines should trigger Ore Trucks to start harvesting.
data.body:
It's not entirely uncommon to hit the Ore Mine when targeting an ore patch with your Ore Truck. It will move right next to it and idle. 

I noticed that if an Ore Truck is sent to an ore patch cell and before it reaches it, another unit occupies it, the Ore Truck will start harvesting the closest cell - if the ore mine could trigger the same behaviour as the ore, it would weed out this small inconvenience.

data.title: Install openra-utility
data.body: A shortcut for `mono --debug /usr/lib/openra/OpenRA.Utility.exe` probably `/usr/bin/openra-utility` with an automatically generated man page.

data.title: Removed the unused jeep unload sequence
data.body: We don't use the unload animations (anymore) so this workaround isn't required. Redundant to idle anyway so that sequence can be referenced when it makes a return. Might save a small amount of space on the sprite map. PS: This applies to a few other occasions as well. Updated accordingly.

data.title: Added Scott's Allies03 co-op multiplayer mission as "Exodus"

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body: @ScottNZ's original mission converted from the [C# mission code found in release-20131223](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/release-20131223/OpenRA.Mods.RA/Missions/Allies03Script.cs). This port is very faithful to the original. However I changed a lot of checks that were done every n ticks to use triggers instead, which didn't exist back then. As a result this should run pretty smooth.

data.title: Failed execution on Ubuntu
data.body:
First off, I apologize if this isn't the proper way or place to post such a thing - I am admittedly new to using GitHub for anything more involved than checking someone's shared project. But I have no idea how to fix this problem that appeared out of nowhere, and so far none of the searches I've done on Google or in this Issues section have turned up any results. So if this doesn't belong here, by all means delete/close it.

I've been playing **OpenRA** on **Ubuntu** for several months without any significant issues - most of the errors I run into every now and then are mapmaking-related ones, either by maps I try to create or maps made by other users with problematic tiles or coding. But all of a sudden, I can no longer launch the program without it failing to execute, and I'm not familiar enough with Ubuntu to troubleshoot the problem on my own. I'm too used to a Windows operating system and this one is still relatively foreign to me.

As far as I can tell, the problem isn't with OpenRA's version, because the most recent one is **20160508**, which I have been using for at least a week or two prior to this problem without any issues.

This is the output of trying to run "**openra**" in **terminal**:

```
Native stacktrace:

    mono() [0x49ff2f]
    mono() [0x426c8c]
    /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0(+0x113d0) [0x7f7b25bd13d0]
    mono() [0x53e1b8]
    mono() [0x427361]
    mono(mono_main+0x2cb) [0x475abb]
    /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(__libc_start_main+0xf0) [0x7f7b25817830]
    mono(_start+0x29) [0x422e79]

Debug info from gdb:

[New LWP 5877]
[Thread debugging using libthread_db enabled]
Using host libthread_db library "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libthread_db.so.1".

Got a SIGSEGV while executing native code. This usually indicates a fatal error in the mono runtime or one of the native libraries used by your application.

Aborted (core dumped)
Gtk-Message: GtkDialog mapped without a transient parent. This is discouraged.
```

This does not generate any log files in "**.openra/Logs**". I even checked this by removing all the log files and re-executing to see if new log files were made, and none were. (I have still kept the log files though, in case I'm incorrect about this and it's not supposed to generate new ones or something?)

I have tried uninstalling OpenRA and then reinstalling, but the issue persists.

I have no idea what to check in order to fix this. My only guess was that one of my packages/dependencies on Unbuntu updated and now  no longer works properly with OpenRA, but I don't know how to check which would cause this or how to fix the problem. I've tried "**sudo apt-get update**" on terminal as well, hoping it would further update any related dependencies and squash the issue, but no luck there either.

Any help or insights you might have would be very appreciated. If there's any further info I can provide to help out, I certainly can - I don't know what else to include here yet since the only output I could find of the problem was in terminal.

data.title: Added ScreenMap support for effects
data.body: now with laser :red_circle: and tesla :zap: support. Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9443.

data.title: Additional hotkey modifiers for producing units
data.body:
Hello,

currently there are 3 "**modifiers**" for producing units(/buildings): 
shift+lmb (add 5 units),  shift+rmb (remove 5 units),  ctrl+rmb (remove all units of type)

**I would propose adding some more**, most importantly:
shift+ctrl+rmb  (**cancel all units in queue**, e.g. "all infantry")

And as important, but more controversial:
**rmb->hold->release for holding production** and rmb->release for cancelling one unit. Since you use the latter way more often and there is no way of cancelling during production right now.
I think the behaviour as it is now is annoying, only that one got used to it :D ("hold! ""hold!""cancelled!")
EDIT: Middle-mouse button cancels during production. However, not all mouses have middle mouse buttons!

_[please ignore following section, see comment below]_
Also, an infinite modifier would be nice: 
ctrl+lmb (adds one unit to a "infinite queue")

The infinite queue behaviour could be like this:
- produce x units as ordred, then go to next order
- if there are no more ordinary orders, check infinite queue entries and add one round of them to the production queue order list
- in the UI a little infinity sign would show before the ammount of units ordered in one round
- additional unit orders of the same type add/substract allways from the infinite queue (so there cannot be an ordinary and infinite order in parallel)

i.e. suppose 5 rocket troopers are in a queue. Shift+crl+lmb(rocket soldier icon) would add 5 more rocket soldiers and transform this order into an infinite queue order. (Rocket sodier icon)^(inf 10)

Thanks, i hope we will see at least rmb-hold and crtl+shift-cancel soon in the future :)

data.title: Listing an actor in Cargo.InitialUnits which grants an upgrade through Passenger won't be applied to the transport.
Added a filter for repeated move orders
data.body: as suggested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3923#issuecomment-34561991. You can see the benefit of units not halting for every click as this avoids https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3288 at least when you click at the exact same tile.

milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body: Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5908.

For the bounty #7916

I don't have an opinion on how long the delay should be so feedback please!

data.title: Check that noiseDirection is not a zero
data.body: fix unexpected freezes that can happen because of infinity loop in RescanForTargets

data.title: Fixed inappropriate usage of SharedRandom
data.body: A broad-spectrum anti-desync against https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/11660.

data.title: OpenRA doesn't copy from mounted CD images when a physical unit is in the drive
data.body: openra not find the CD, he gives me "error: copyng files from cd failed" ... I think it's because I have an ISO image of the CD in my language, regularly mounted, but he tries in the physical unit. How can I make him read other units?

data.title: Subtraction of two CPos values returns error
data.body:
Attempting to perform a subtraction of two CPos values does not give a CVec as expected.
It appears that the engine thinks it should treat it as **CPos - CVec**, which, unsurprisingly, returns an error.

Error found by performing the following calculation
`local vec = someactor.Location - someactor2.Location`

Error message (first line)
 ===============
C:\Program Files (x86)\OpenRA\/lua/sandbox.lua:150: [string "BindingSupport.lua"]:30: Uncaught CLR exception at Lua->CLR boundary: System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> System.Reflection.TargetInvocationException: Exception has been thrown by the target of an invocation. ---> Eluant.LuaException: [string "BindingSupport.lua"]:30: **Attempted to call CPos.Subtract(CPos, CVec) with invalid arguments (CPos, CPos)**

data.title: Player Info Panel does not become active until you hover the pointer over the players latency

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
In a Game Lobby, I have noticed that when you hover the cursor over a spawn point on the map it displays the player name and team name.

For some reason this information panel only becomes active after you hover over any of the players latency indicator (Green / Orange / Red / Grey rectangle).

I'm guessing this is a bug? It's useful on large maps where players have similar colors to each other but might have selected the wrong team.

data.title: Force Fire on a unit that gets hidden by fog
data.body:
When you force fire on a point on the map where a unit is visible but then gets hidden by fog. The force firing unit will stop their action and just auto attack the closest enemy.

The best example of this having a V2 that is ordered to force fire on a location which was revealed by a spy plane.

I think force firing should override the "can't fire into fog" fix

data.title: Content installer should validate existing content before skipping it.
data.body:
> I had a similar grievance awhile ago when OpenRA install incorrectly, resulting it graphical glitches ingame. The usual method of uninstalling & reinstalling the program didn't fix the problem tho. Because unbeknown to me there were files in My Documents that had been corrupted during installation & uninstalling OpenRA didn't remove these files. Reinstalling didn't rewrite them either, so I had to find & delete them manually before I could do a clean reinstall.

http://www.ppmforums.com/viewtopic.php?t=42305 highlights that we require manual intervention to correct corrupted files.  This is still a problem with the new system, which unconditionally skips any files that already exist.

We should add at least a length check (but ideally a proper checksum) to validate content when deciding whether to overwrite or skip it.
